titleStmt.title: R. E. Collins et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5637

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thos E Bramlette Govr of Ky.

Your Petitioner John Warfield States that at the February term 1864, of the Franklin Circuit Court a Judgment on behalf of the Commonwealth was rendered against him for Sixty Dollars and lasts upon an Indictment charging him with tippling

He States that two of his sons viz William and Richard Warfield had liquor on his farm that while his wife was Confined having with Sickness from which She died his two sons sold liquor to several persons against his direction He States that he never sold any liquor him Self and being poor and he prays your Excellency to remit said Judgment

Jun 23. 1864
R E Collins
A H Rennick
Jno Robinsan
C. Callaghan
R. H. Woodson
John Whitehead
J McGrath
W. B. Robinson
Robert E. Finnell
Edmond Barnes
J T Daniel
R B. Gillsen
J. Harlan Jr
W R Bacon
Jno Warfield
G W Gwin
Robert Church
G W Owen
H. B. Innes
Capt Sanford Goin
J. V. Butler
W. B. Holeman

Franklin Cir Ct
vsÂ
John Warfield
$60
